history.content:
You can P/NP any amount of courses, as long as you don't count them towards your major reqs. So yes, if you already have enough EECS courses to fulfill all the degree requirements you can take any number on top of that P/NP without facing any problems.

https://engineering.berkeley.edu/passednot-passed-pnp-grading-option You can P/NP up to 1/3 of your total units at Berkeley. If you have completed all your EECS reqs, you can take technical classes P/NP. Probably a good idea to check in w/ your ESS advisor or EECS department advisors, if you want to double check you've completed your requirements.

You can P/NP any amount of courses, as long as you don't count them towards your major reqs. So yes, if you already have enough EECS courses to fulfill all the degree requirements you can take any number on top of that P/NP without facing any problems.
I've taken enough EECS courses to graduate, but still have another year here. I know you aren't allowed to PNP courses for the major, but if I don't need the course for the major, am I allowed to?
history.subject: PNP EECS Courses?
